Dear Kari Klinski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 punched Youth A.
Investigation I spoke to DHHS Worker on 7/26/23. Scheduling and allegations
were discussed.
I spoke to Complainant 1 on 7/25/23. No new information was
provided.
I reviewed the video of 7/25/23. The video shows Staff 1 and
Staff 3 on the unit with the entire unit. Staff 1 is talking back and
forth with Youth A. Staff 3 stands up and goes to Staff 1 and
Youth A attempting to stop their conversation. Youth A gets up
and then Staff 1 gets up and Staff 1 swings at Youth A with force
that causes her to fall onto the ground after she swings. Staff 1 did
make contact with Youth A on the side of his face. Youth A
attempted to swing back but did not hit Staff 1. Staff 1 got back on
her feet jumping around the room like a boxer in the ring. Multiple
staff were in the unit at this point and security grabbed Youth A
and escorted Staff 1 out of the unit.
Interviews were conducted face to face at the facility on
7/27/23 with DHHS Worker:
Administrator 1: Administrator 1 reported that Staff 1 is a new
staff that just completed orientation and was on day one of
shadowing staff. Administrator 1 reported that Staff 1 was not a
part of the staff to youth ratio. Administrator 1 reported that the
agency nurse saw Youth A after the incident, but he refused a
referral to the hospital. Administrator 1 reported the video shows
that Staff 1 attempted to punch Youth A. Youth A did have a small
red mark on the face.
Youth A: Youth A reported Staff 1 worked in the morning shift
with Staff 2. Youth A reported Staff 1 was inappropriate
throughout the day with the youth. Youth A reported Staff 1 would
tell Staff 2, “don’t tell me what to do.” Youth A reported Staff 1 was
disrespectful with her comments. Staff 1 stated a comment that
“all the kids are drug addicts” and called them “sassy little girls.”
Youth A reported when Staff 3 came in for her afternoon shift Staff
1 continued to state disrespectful comments. Youth A reported
Staff 1 was using profanity with the youth. Youth A reported he
told her to “grow up” and Staff 1 stated back, “what are you going
to do about it?” Youth A reported Staff 3 was trying to get Staff 1
to stop talking but Staff 1 didn’t listen. Youth A reported that after
he stood up, Staff 1 punched him in the face. Youth A reported he
2

went to hit her and then security came out. Youth A reported that
Staff 3 was requesting for security to come to the unit before they
both stood up. Youth A reported he saw the nurse after the
incident but refused to go to the hospital.
Staff 2: Staff 2 reported that he worked with Staff 1 throughout the
day. Staff 2 reported he noted Staff 1 went “back and forth” with
the youth. Staff 2 reported that during shadowing, staff are
supposed to just watch but Staff 1 was not doing that. Staff 2
reported he noted a “power struggle” between Staff 1 and the
youth. Staff 2 reported he had asked her to help him in a couple
situations and she did not, but he wasn’t sure if she was not
wanting to listen or didn’t hear. Although Staff 1 was not to
supervise youth and only shadow, Staff 2 reported since he was
the only staff on the unit, he did have to ask Staff 1 to help him
throughout the day with tasks. Staff 2 reported he did not
communicate with her about her behavior or step in when the
youth and Staff 1 were going “back and forth.”
Staff 3: Staff 3 reported she came for her shift and the youth were
in their rooms. Staff 3 reports, Staff 1 had told her that she “threw”
snacks in their rooms already. Staff 3 reported when they let the
youth out of their rooms, they escalated quickly. Staff 3 heard
someone say, “get this bitch out of the pod,” referring to Staff 1.
Staff 3 reported the youth said that Staff 1 called them, “faggots”
and “gay ass” since the morning. Staff 3 reported she called for
supervision over the radio due to the climate of the pod. Staff 3
reported that Youth A was agitated so Staff 3 asked him to take
five minutes in his room and then come back out. When Youth A
came back out, he sat at the table and Staff 1 started calling the
youth names. Staff 3 reported she attempted to stop Staff 1, but it
would not work. Staff 3 reported Youth A said, “I am sick of this
shit” and Staff 1 stated back to youth A, “do something about it.”
Staff 3 reported Youth A got up from the table to pour water on
Staff 1 and pushed Staff 1 and then Staff 1 punched Youth A.
Staff 3 reported Security 1 came in and grabbed Youth A. Staff 1
was still jumping around like she wanted to fight but then was
escorted out by security. Staff 3 reported they have a 1:5 staff to
student ratio and she was the only one working on the pod with
Staff 1.
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D: All youth reported that Staff 1
was disrespectful to the youth and Staff 2 throughout the day. All
reported that they were called “sassy girls.” All youth reported that
Staff 1 threw a punch and hit Youth A. All youth reported that Staff
3

1 was the second staff on their unit for the morning and afternoon
shift.
Security: Security reported that he went to the pod during first
shift and Staff 1 was sitting in her chair with her eyes closed as if
she was sleeping. Security 1 reported he woke her up and told her
she was to be aware of the pod. Security 1 reported later they had
been in the pod after Youth A and Staff 1 were separated and
Staff 1 was escorted out.
Staff 1: Staff 1 did not show up for her interview. Later in the day
she did come into the facility and the DHHS Worker was still in the
building. DHHS Worker attempted to interview Staff 1. Staff 1 did
come into the interview room but would not partake in the
interview and was escorted out by security guards.
I reviewed the following documents:
Incident report: Incident report was written on 7/25/23 and is
consistent with interviews.
Staff 1 personnel file: Training documents were reviewed, and
Staff 1 had completed her orientation. Clearances were completed
and appropriate.
Youth Health Referral and Medical Assessment: Completed on
7/25/23 noted as follow up to the incident.
Analysis Video observation and interviews from all staff and youth, except
Staff 1 confirm that Staff 1 physically assaulted Youth A, by
punching Youth A in the face.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to student ratio
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-
Description resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
4

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency did not have a sufficient number of staff to provide for
the care of the youth.
Investigation Note: There were 10 youth on the pod on this day.
Interviews:
Administrator 1: Administrator 1 reported that Staff 1 is a new
staff that just completed orientation and was on day one of
shadowing staff. Administrator 1 reported that Staff 1 was not a
part of the staff to student ratio.
Staff 2: Staff 2 reported he had to ask for Staff 1’s help because
she was the other staff with him for his shift.
Staff 3: Staff 3 reported Staff 1 was working the shift with her
although she was in shadowing.
Youth B, youth C, and Youth D: All youth reported that Staff 1
was the second staff in their unit for the morning and afternoon
shift.
I reviewed the following policy:
Staff to Youth Ratio: …during normal waking hours shall be no
less than 1:5
Analysis During the morning and second shift there was only one “regular”
staff supervising the youth. The second staff member was a new
staff completing the shadowing part of her training and not to be
counted in the staff to student ratio. The agency failed to maintain
its’ identified staff to resident ratio. The identified staff ratio is one
to five. The staffing ratio during this incident was one “regular”
staff to 10 youth.
Technical Assistance:
On 8/10/23, Technical Assistance was given in regard to:
Orientation, Shadowing, Supervision, Hiring, training,
accountability, responsibility, documentation regarding supervision
and orientation, training and performance evaluations. A follow up
meeting was held on 8/17/23 with the same technical assistance.
Conclusion Violation Established
5

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 physically assaulted Youth A.
Investigation DHHS Worker reported on 8/16/23 she had a confirmed case
for Staff 1.
Analysis Staff 1 does not have the ability to provide care for the population
served at the facility, therefore her actions resulted in a confirmed
case with DHHS Worker.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
